0.cdata!:
Republique Centrafricaine - Projet de
            response la crise alimentaire

abstracts.cdata!:
The projects overall development
            objectives are to: (i) provide increased food access to
            primary and pre-school students in targeted areas; and (ii)
            support farmers capacity to ensure adequate supply response
            for medium-term improvement in food security. The negative
            effects on the human environment are: risks associated with
            the use of pesticides by farmers themselves; conflicts
            relating to law and land use (cohabitation between various
            rights, claims in each village); potential conflicts between
            agriculture and livestock and the development of waterborne
            disease (an increased prevalence of malaria, increased cases
            of dysentery, an increase of schistosomiasis, ...), the risk
            of diversion objectives of the project (changes to other
            beneficiaries than originally envisaged because of
            difficulties in development); risks to health and safety in
            pesticide management (contamination by livestock watering;
            poisoning in cases of misuse; residues on products, poor
            management of packaging, etc..), the depletion and
            degradation of water sources; the conflicts over land use or
            water and possible cumulative effects of a breakdown, the
            inequitable access rights to land or water (particularly
            women), difficulties regarding the integration of women in
            agricultural activities. On the biophysical environment, the
            major potential negative impacts include: loss of vegetation
            and reduction of biodiversity in deforestation and clearing
            of plots; degradation due to soil salinization, soil
            acidification, the drop in fertility due to cultivation
            practices, soil erosion, loss or reduction of land for
            pasture degradation of water quality (pollution of streams
            and lakes).
